ayas.translation: Nay! I swear by this city.

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

ayas.translation: And you shall be made free from obligation in this city--
And the begetter and whom he begot.
Certainly We have created man to be in distress.

ayas.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
ayas.translation: Does he think that no one has power over him?
He shall say: I have wasted much wealth.
Does he think that no one sees him?
Have We not given him two eyes,
And a tongue and two lips,
And pointed out to him the two conspicuous ways?
But he would not attempt the uphill road,
And what will make you comprehend what the uphill road is?
(It is) the setting free of a slave,

ayas.arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَـٰمٌ فِى يَوْمٍ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍ
ayas.translation: Or the giving of food in a day of hunger
ayas.transliteration: aw iṭ`āmun fī yawmin dhī masghabah

ayas.translation: To an orphan, having relationship,
Or to the poor man lying in the dust.

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
ayas.translation: Then he is of those who believe and charge one another to show patience, and charge one another to show compassion.
ayas.transliteration: thumma kāna minal ladhīna āmanū watawāṣaw biṣ ṣabri watawāṣaw bil marḥamah

ayas.translation: These are the people of the right hand.

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
ayas.translation: And (as for) those who disbelieve in our communications, they are the people of the left hand.
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyātinā hum aṣ-ḥābul mash-amah

ayas.translation: On them is fire closed over.
